text: My mother was a lady. Thatâ€™s the way people remember her. Itâ€™s a recurring theme in the messages of condolence, even from those who hadnâ€™t seen her in decades. Â I probably inherited more of her stubbornness and determination. â€¦ Going through my parentsâ€™ papers brings history alive. Â An aged postcard from Lithuania. Childhood drawings by grandchildren now in their twenties and thirties.Â Certificates, articles, letters and photographs. Itâ€™s the end of an era.

My dear friend,I am sorry to hear of your loss. No matter how old we are we are still our motherâ€™s child. I am happy that you have been left with such a rich history to help her memory live on. Often times we find those memories are what best sustain us.Sincerely,JoAnn
